subject: Collaboration
description_text:
Hi,

My name is Alessandro, and I’m reaching out on behalf of Simracing da
Ragionieri, a recently launched and fast-growing Italian YouTube channel
focused on sim racing hardware reviews.

Our channel was born to fill a gap in the Italian market, where
high-quality, down-to-earth hardware reviews were lacking. We focus on what
truly matters to real-world users — performance, value, and practicality —
rather than just enthusiast or pro-level gear.

We’re already seeing strong engagement and traction, and we’re proud to be
collaborating with brands like Simagic, Moza, Cammus, and Conspit, who have
trusted us with their products.

We’d be very interested in reviewing your hardware as well. If this sounds
like a potential opportunity, feel free to contact us at your convenience —
we’d be glad to discuss further.

Wishing you a great day and continued success!

Best regards,
Alessandro "Il Ragioniere" Vandini
Simracing da Ragionieri

conversations.body_text: Hi Alessandro Vandini,    Okay, we will submit your information to our manager for review. Thank you for contacting us. We look forward to working with you!

Thank you, looking forward to it.

Have a nice day.

Alessandro "il ragionere" Vandini

Il ven 22 ago 2025, 12:14 service@simsonn.com

Hi Simsonn team,

Thanks a lot for your trust and kind words! I can’t wait to put your
product through its paces and show the Italian sim racing community what
it’s really capable of. It’s going to be fun stressing it to the limit and
confirming its quality on track.

Here’s my shipping address:

Alessandro Vandini
Strada Borelle 268
41126 Modena (IT)

Best regards,
Alessandro Vandini

Il gio 11 set 2025, 11:02 General and sales enquiries

Hi,

Thanks for the update! Really looking forward to receiving the package and
starting the tests.

Just to give you a clear idea of our workflow: our reviews usually take
about 5–8 weeks after receiving the product, depending on the complexity.
Pedals in particular always take a bit longer, since we stress-test them
daily in every possible combination before publishing.

If no other reviews of the same type are already in progress, and the unit
arrives within this month, we’ll likely be able to release the video around
November.

Can’t wait to put it on the rig and share the results with the Italian sim
racing community!

Best,
Alessandro

Best regards.

Alessandro

correct Pro X Ultra also be arriving? That way we can organize ourselves to
review both, or just this one.

Best regards and have a great day from Simracing da Ragionieri.

> Il mar 16 set 2025, 06:02 General and sales enquiries

Hi there,

The package has safely arrived, and we honestly can’t wait to open it up!
All the content we create will be completely at your disposal for any
social use that could be helpful. We’re just wrapping up the testing of
another pedal set, so from next week we should be able to dive into this
one.

Looking forward to it!

Best,
Simracing da Ragionieri

Il lun 22 set 2025, 10:40 General and sales enquiries

Hello Simsonn Team,

Thank you for your message. We haven’t encountered any issues so far —
everything is working well. We’re still in the process of testing all the
different spring and elastomer combinations on the pedals, and we plan to
record the full review video soon.

Once we have more material ready, we’ll be happy to upload it to Google
Drive and share it with you. In the meantime, we’ve already published a
short and straightforward YouTube video to let our followers know that we
have the product and are testing it. This way we can start building
curiosity and interest around it.

We’ll keep you updated as we move forward.

Best regards,
Alessandro
Simracing da Ragionieri


Il dom 28 set 2025, 05:43 General and sales enquiries

Hi guys,

Sure thing, we've posted a shorts teasing the Pedals review

https://youtube.com/shorts/J3dcsRzPuD8?feature=share

Friday we have a 2h race when we'll shoot the action footages for the
review and then we're ready to edit and post the full review.

Everythings Is working flawless, no EMI, no issues at all even with our
test setup with the csl DD that Is known to cause EMI.

Let me know if you want some very raw footage, we have already some
unedited and yet to be analized to see if they can fit in the review.

Best regards.

Alessandro

Il lun 13 ott 2025, 09:36 General and sales enquiries

Hi Simsonn Team ,

Thanks a lot for your message and for the trust — we’re really happy to
share with you the script we prepared after our stress test sessions. It’s
not our usual workflow, but since this is our first collaboration, we’re
glad to make an exception.

When it comes to pedal sets, we always take our time before releasing a
review. The initial feeling is important, but what really matters is
durability over time — especially for elastomers and load cells. That’s why
our reviews never come out after just one month of testing: we want to be
100% fair and transparent with the audience, and misleading consumers isn’t
an option for us.

No problem at all to share the final video before it goes public — as soon
as it’s ready, we’ll send it over. At the moment, we’re reviewing several
products from Simagic, Conspit, VNM, Simsonn, Asetek, Racewerk, Acelith,
and SimDesign, so the release date depends on when our videomaker can fit
it into his editing schedule (he also works with Serie A basketball,
volleyball, and Serie B and C football here in Italy — so he’s quite busy).

We’ll update you as soon as we have a confirmed shooting date.
Let us know what you think of the script — the English version obviously
loses a bit of the Italian slang and tone that make the review more “ours,”
but the message should come across clearly.

Thanks again for the collaboration and support!

Best regards,
*Alessandro “Il Ragioniere” Vandini*
*Simracing da Ragionieri*
------------------------------
 *SCRIPT – (italiano)*

*INTRO*

Ciao ragazzi e bentornati su *Simracing da Ragionieri!*
Oggi vi porto una pedaliera che mi ha davvero… sorpreso.
La *Simsonn Plus X*.

È una pedaliera che punta chiaramente a sfidare le migliori nel rapporto
*qualità-prezzo*,
e dopo un po’ di test… vi dico la verità: ci riesce.
E pure bene.

Come sempre, andiamo per ordine:
prima *estetica e materiali*,
poi *dotazione tecnica*,
*feeling in pista*,
e infine il *prezzo*, per capire se vale davvero quello che costa.
------------------------------
*1. Estetica e materiali*

Appena la monti in postazione… la *Simsonn Plus X* fa subito la sua figura.

Esteticamente richiama tantissimo la *Heusinkveld Sprint*,
che ormai è un po’ lo *standard visivo* delle pedaliere moderne:
linee pulite, design tecnico,
quel look professionale che ti fa sentire veloce anche da fermo.

Noi la troviamo *davvero bella*,
soprattutto in questa *versione nera opaca*,
con le *pedaline personalizzate da Simsonn*:
ben fatte, solide e visivamente appaganti.

Anche la *control box* è curata:
piccola, pulita, con un design coerente col resto della pedaliera.

Unico appunto: gli *angoli non sono smussati* come sulle pedaliere top di
gamma…
ma nulla di drammatico.
E soprattutto — e qui parlo da vero ragioniere del simracing —
*si può usare tranquillamente anche con i calzini*.
Nessun rischio di perdere un dito in staccata!
------------------------------
*2. Dotazione tecnica*

Dal punto di vista tecnico, qui c’è tanta sostanza.

La Plus X monta una *cella di carico da 200 kg*,
abbinata a un *sensore molto sensibile e preciso*.
Il risultato è un freno consistente, progressivo e molto naturale.

Il tutto è gestito dal *Simsonn Manager*,
che è praticamente un *clone del Simagic Pro Manager* —
e questo è un bene, perché quel software è uno dei migliori in circolazione.
Semplice, completo e immediato da regolare.

Poi, a livello meccanico, la dotazione è ottima:
ci sono *tre set di elastomeri* di diversa durezza,
che permettono di personalizzare la sensazione del pedale del freno.

Facendo due conti da veri ragionieri:
3 elastomeri… danno *3³ = 27 combinazioni possibili*.
Ventisette!
Praticamente impossibile non trovare il setup giusto,
dal morbido stradale al duro da GT3.

E per chi vuole ancora di più,
Simsonn offre anche *motori aptici e lineari opzionali*,
che aggiungono vibrazioni e feedback diretti sui pedali.
Noi non abbiamo avuto modo di provarli,
quindi non possiamo confermarne la qualità,
ma le recensioni che si trovano in rete *ne parlano molto bene*.
Sulla carta, renderebbero la Plus X una pedaliera *completa anche nel
feeling tattile*.
------------------------------
*3. Feeling e comportamento in gara*

L’abbiamo testata ovunque:
*Le Mans Ultimate*, *Assetto Corsa Competizione*, *EVO* e *RaceRoom*.

In tutte le prove si è comportata *in modo eccellente*,
sia nelle *gare brevi* che nelle *endurance più lunghe*,
dove molte pedaliere economiche cominciano a cedere.

La Plus X, invece, resta *stabile, coerente e molto prevedibile*.
Il freno ha una progressione naturale,
permette un ottimo controllo in trail braking,
l’acceleratore è fluido e la frizione precisa.

Nessun gioco, nessuna flessione, nessuna sensazione cheap.
È una pedaliera che *monti, regoli e ti dimentichi di toccare per mesi*.
Che, fidatevi, nel simracing… è oro.
------------------------------
*4. Prezzo e conclusione*

E arriviamo al prezzo,
che fortunatamente non è un colpo al cuore.

La *Simsonn Plus X* viene proposta a cifre *molto competitive*:

   -

   *2 pedali senza baseplate*: circa *279 euro*
   -

   *3 pedali senza baseplate*: circa *329 euro*
   -

   *2 pedali con baseplate*: circa *319 euro*
   -

   *3 pedali con baseplate*: circa *369 euro*

Per quello che offre, è davvero *un affare*.

La mettiamo tranquillamente *a livello della Simnet SP Pro*,
che oggi è il *riferimento nella fascia media* per qualità e prestazioni.

In definitiva, la Simsonn Plus X è una *pedaliera completa, precisa e ben
supportata dal software*,
a un prezzo onestissimo.

Gli unici compromessi sono nelle *finiture*,
leggermente meno raffinate rispetto alle pedaliere top,
ma niente che influisca sull’esperienza in pista.

È una pedaliera *che consigliamo senza esitazioni*,
adatta sia a chi si sta costruendo la prima postazione seria,
sia a chi cerca un upgrade sensato *senza buttare via lo stipendio*.
------------------------------
*OUTRO*

Insomma… la *Simsonn Plus X* è una di quelle pedaliere che ti fanno dire:
“ok, non serve spendere mille euro per avere qualcosa di solido, preciso e
divertente da usare”.

Speriamo che questo test vi sia stato utile per orientarvi tra le mille
opzioni là fuori.

Se vi è piaciuto il video, *lasciate un like, iscrivetevi al canale*,
e scrivetemi nei commenti se volete vederla *a confronto con la Simnet SP
Pro*
o con la nuova *idraulica low-cost di Conspit* che stiamo aspettando di
provare.

Alla prossima, da Alessandro —
il *Ragioniere del Simracing!*
------------------------------
*ENGLISH VERSION – Natural Reading Script*
------------------------------
*INTRO*

Hey guys, welcome back to *Simracing da Ragionieri!*
Today we’re testing a pedal set that really surprised me: the *Simsonn Plus
X*.

It’s clearly designed to challenge the best in the *price-to-performance*
category,
and after testing it for a while… I can honestly say, it does a great job.

We’ll go step by step:
*design and materials*,
*technical features*,
*driving feel*,
and finally the *price*, to see if it’s really worth it.
------------------------------
*1. Design and Materials*

Once mounted, the *Simsonn Plus X* immediately looks great in the rig.

Its design clearly draws inspiration from the *Heusinkveld Sprint*,
which has become the *visual standard* for modern pedal sets:
clean lines, technical design, and that “pro driver” vibe.

We find it *very good-looking*, especially in this *matte black version*
with *Simsonn’s custom pedal plates*,
which are solid, elegant, and well-finished.

The *control box* is also nicely built — small, tidy, and well integrated
with the rest.

If we had to nitpick, the *edges aren’t as smooth* as on premium pedals,
but it’s nothing major.
And yes — you can *use it with socks* without fear of slicing your toes
during braking!
------------------------------
*2. Technical Features*

Now let’s talk tech.
The Plus X uses a *200 kg load cell*, combined with a *very precise
pressure sensor*.
That gives the brake pedal a solid, progressive, and natural feel.

It’s managed by the *Simsonn Manager*,
which is basically a *clone of the Simagic Pro Manager* —
and that’s a very good thing,
since the Simagic software is one of the best out there:
simple, intuitive, and complete.

Mechanically, you get *three sets of elastomers* of different hardness
levels,
allowing you to fine-tune the brake feel.

And, doing some accountant-style math:
3 elastomers mean *3³ = 27 possible combinations* —
so you’ll definitely find your sweet spot.

For those who want even more immersion,
Simsonn also offers *optional haptic and linear motors*
that can add vibration and tactile feedback directly to the pedals.
We didn’t have the chance to test them,
so we can’t confirm the quality firsthand,
but the reviews online speak *very highly* of them.
On paper, they would make the Plus X *one of the most complete pedal sets*
in its price range.
------------------------------
*3. Driving Feel*

We tested it across multiple sims:
*Le Mans Ultimate*, *Assetto Corsa Competizione*, *EVO*, and *RaceRoom*.

It performed *excellent* in all of them —
both in *short races* and in *long endurance sessions*,
where cheaper pedals usually start showing their limits.

The Plus X remained *stable, consistent, and predictable*.
The brake is progressive and allows fine control during trail braking,
the throttle is smooth, and the clutch feels clean and precise.

No flex, no play, no cheap sensations.
It’s the kind of pedal set you *install, tune once, and forget about* —
and that’s high praise in simracing.
------------------------------
*4. Price and Conclusion*

The good news: it’s *very well priced*.

   -

   *2 pedals, no baseplate*: around *€279*
   -

   *3 pedals, no baseplate*: around *€329*
   -

   *2 pedals with baseplate*: around *€319*
   -

   *3 pedals with baseplate*: around *€369*

For what it offers, that’s *a great deal*.

We’d put it right next to the *Simnet SP Pro*,
which is currently the *benchmark in the mid-range* segment.

All in all, the *Simsonn Plus X* is *complete, precise, and supported by
excellent software*,
at a price that makes a lot of sense.

The only real compromises are in the *finish details*,
slightly less refined than high-end pedals —
but nothing that affects performance.

It’s a *strongly recommended* pedal set,
perfect for both newcomers to serious simracing
and those looking for a smart, budget-friendly upgrade.
------------------------------
*OUTRO*

So, in short: the *Simsonn Plus X* proves you don’t need to spend a fortune
to get something solid, precise, and genuinely fun to drive.

I hope this review helps you make sense of the chaos that is the simracing
hardware market.

If you liked the video, *hit the like button, subscribe*,
and let me know in the comments if you’d like to see the Plus X
compared directly with the *Simnet SP Pro*,
or with the upcoming *low-cost hydraulic pedal set from Conspit* we’re
waiting to test.

See you next time —

> Hi Alessandro,
>
> Hope you’re doing well!
>
> How did the race go? We hope everything went smoothly and you got some
> great action footage!
> We’re really looking forward to seeing your full review and wanted to
> kindly ask how the video production is progressing.
>
> Do you have an estimated release date for the video? If possible, we’d
> love to preview it before it goes live — and if you’ve already prepared a
> script or outline, we’d be happy to take a look as well.
>
> Thanks again for your time and effort — we truly appreciate your
> collaboration!
>
> Best regards,
> The Simsonn Team

>

Hi Simsonn Team,

We’ve got a little surprise for you! You probably thought we were going to
make just *one* video about Simsonn products… but guess what? There will be
*two!*

We actually purchased a *Simsonn Pro X Ultra* on AliExpress and put it to
the test side by side with the one you kindly sent us. For our audience,
the first video will be this one — here’s an early look (not public yet).
It’s scheduled to go live next week, most likely on Monday, unless we
decide to make a few last-minute edits.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KCcWvQY8zDCJF5J7XJRFOBkONMoBYpyR/view?usp=sharing

We’ll let some time pass to evaluate its reach and performance, and then
we’ll publish the review of the *Plus X* you sent us before Christmas —
perfectly timed for the peak of the annual buying season.

Please let us know if you’d like any specific clips or materials from the
video. We’ll keep you updated once the other video is edited and scheduled,
and if we make any changes to this one before the final release.

Thanks a lot for your trust and support — it really means a lot. We’d also
be happy to review other Simsonn products in the future, especially your
upcoming *direct drive base*, which — if released at classic “Simsonn
prices” — could genuinely shake up the market far more than any pedal set!

Best regards and thank you again,
*Alessandro – Simracing da Ragionieri*

Good morning Simsonn team,
and season’s greetings!

We were finally filming the review of the pedal set when, suddenly, we
heard a loud CRACK.
Right after that, these parts came off the throttle pedal, which is now no
longer working.

Could you please let us know how to proceed and how this issue can be
resolved?
Thank you very much in advance for your support, and best regards.

Kind regards,
Alessandro Vandini
Simracing da Ragionieri
